column6: 32}}, the line of kings lasted for 3,287 years, until [[Ar-Pharazôn]] brought about the [[Downfall of Númenor]].<ref>{{UT

column1: All the Kings of Númenor used either the [[Quenya]] prefix ''[[Tar]]'' or the [[Adûnaic]] prefix ''[[Ar]]'' before their royal name. Both prefixes meant "High".

column9: A lord of the [[Edain]] and founder of the Kingdom of [[Númenor]].

column10: Vardamir Nólimon]]. His rule was only titular.

column8: During his reign [[Númenóreans]] first sailed back to [[Middle-earth]].

column9: High King]] [[Gil-galad]] defeats [[Sauron]] and ends the [[War of the Elves and Sauron]].

column8: [[Númenóreans]] begin military occupation of other lands.
First king to speak against the [[Ban of the Valar]].
Establishment of the [[King's Men]] and the [[Faithful]].

column10: husband]] to rule the kingdom for her.

column9: Illegally claimed Kingship of [[Númenor]]. After his death he was removed from the Line of Kings.

column8: First king to adopt an [[Adûnaic]] name.

column9: Elves]] from [[Tol Eressëa]] now only visited in secret.

column8: Attempted to bring back the old traditions of [[Númenor]].

Usurped the [[Sceptre]]. Defeated and captured [[Sauron]] who later corrupted him.
Led the [[Great Armament]] fleet to break the [[Ban of the Valar]], causing the [[Downfall of Númenor]].
